issue.title: Compilation error on Windows due to not found UCRT headers

content.raw:
I tried to also enable the tests, and everything is  working as expected. Indeed, the find logic of the UCRT headers seems to be working fine on the Jenkins build \(see [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/lastBuild/consoleText](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/lastBuild/consoleText)\). I have no idea why that happens. Possibly the  Jenkins build is still running on Windows 7, and there the registry  key used to find the headers works fine?  

In  any case, given this experience I think a reasonable hotfix that should work fine on Windows 10 with a recent CMake  and  avoid to break the existing Jenkins job, is to include the  UCRT headers if they are found.
content.html:
I tried to also enable the tests, and everything is working as expected. Indeed, the find logic of the UCRT headers seems to be working fine on the Jenkins build (see https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/lastBuild/consoleText). I have no idea why that happens. Possibly the Jenkins build is still running on Windows 7, and there the registry key used to find the headers works fine?

In any case, given this experience I think a reasonable hotfix that should work fine on Windows 10 with a recent CMake and avoid to break the existing Jenkins job, is to include the UCRT headers if they are found.
